page.title: 13Clocktower: 05300183
page.content: Clocktower Square is dominated by the old clocktower which now stands in the middle of a park, the only relic of Caledonian Cattle Market. It is dwarfed by the surrounding modern flats and this contrast continues throughout the area. Early Victorian goods depot and terraced houses stand side by side with flats and houses built within the past five years. The area is still devloping - much open space has been made and there are sites for new industry ready for rental. The people provide an equal contrast. Old indigenous population who have lived here for many generations share their space with newer residents from many different countries. The area is well served with transport and is intersected by underground and overground railways.
